reviews.text: Having looked at hundreds of AI hotels in Mallorca I finally decided on the ROC Bocaccio and am very pleased I did. My hubby and 3 year old daughter and I thoroughly enjoyed our 8-night stay. The hotel entrance is on a busy street in Platya d'Alcudia but once you enter the hotel, calmness descends and the fun begins.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Fantastic Staff, great Value for Money. Loved it!

reviews.text: The good points:
reviews.title: Location,tick, beach bar, tick, food, tick - value big tick!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All the staff were friendly, helpful and welcoming; the entertainment staff in particular were excellent. Lydia, Lucia and Martin did a very good job of running an entertainment programme and kids club with what seemed to be little resources.
reviews.title: Great holiday

reviews.text: The hotel is only 150m from the beach and benefits from it's own beach bar and cafe a little further along the beach - this was a great bonus as we ate lunch at the beach most days and not many 3 star hotels have this. From here we also borrowed buckets and spades and parasols for beach use - free of charge.
reviews.title: Pensioners week!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was of good quality and varied with staple salad/pizza/pasta dishes every day and then a mixture of local and international dishes. The AI beer was lovely, as were the cocktails and the cava. The house wine was not too bad either. Slushies and ice cream for the little one.
reviews.title: Great price, great staff, great food, great location!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we Arrived at the hotel following a transfer from hell in which we arrived very tired and hungery in the early hours of the morning with a very welcoming greeting from staff who directed us to food and beer at the hotel restaurant we was very grateful . The hotel was clean and tidy and the staff where friendly and polite in their manner . Although the hotel catered for more euro peon clientèle the food was ok . However it would not have suited my teenage daughter . It was low season so there was alot of spanish pensioners in the hotel which could be overwhelming at times . overall it was relatively ok hotel with the various cultures and ages .
reviews.title: A Week with the spanish pensioners

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: arrived at this hotel at 5oclock and another bus of spanish arrived i was at front of que and they kept skipping me and serving the spanish then i got given 1 of the rooms that had been renovated which was lovely big walk in shower memory foam mattress on bed and had 2 balconies next the food i am very fussy eater usualy i can eat some things but i was stuck to potatoes chips and bolognese all inclusive drinks were fine. The staff were terrible always served the spanish and germans before the british got served and john behind the bar he was the worst 1 night he refused to serve us drinks at 20 past 11 had to go get reception pool bar was closed no snacks in afternoon no entertainment at night for british people if it wasnt for the people we had met i would have got a flight home they made it a good holiday
reviews.title: avoid hotel if british

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: just had a week ai at this hotel the room we had was perfect and very clean the only downside was we over looked the main st but apart from that the room was great food was varied and there was a lot to choose from the staff were helpful and polite at reception my hands go up to the cleaning staff who did a brill job every day as did the bar staff hello to joan although there wasnt that much laid on in the way of entertainment given the time of year there were other english there and were all chatty thats where the belly full of laughs comes in sean and emma from soufend cheers u2 u made our holiday with the shivers sean x love to charlotte from brecon and finally yes we would stay at the boccaccio again a bit later than april not much open
reviews.title: a belly full of laughs

reviews.text: After reading other review I had to comment on what a great time we had at this hotel. They are obviously in the process of completely renovating this hotel floor by floor as our rooms has been done to an incredibly high standard. We had 3 rooms and although they varied in size they were all very nice and comfortable. Fabulous new fixtures and fitting and very well designed. Yes the majority of other guests were Spanish and some Germans but that didn't make any difference. Most of the staff spoke very good English and with our lousy Spanish we were understood all the time. Our groups ages ranged from 19 to 40ish (!) and as we were all inslusive we spent our evenings in the bar joining in with the other guests. They had various entertainment on which was very good. Even the bingo was done in Spanish & English. The Spanish guests were delighted when we joined in their dancing and we even showed them a few moves of our own. The Staff were on the whole lovely and friendly especially Jaime who worked the bar in the evenings. The pool area was lovely and there were plenty of loungers. The beach is only a 5 minute walk away as well being right by the lake which you can walk round a fair way. I really couldn't fault it. I do think that some people wouldn't enjoy it because it isn't a hotel that just caters for Brits but to me that is a bonus!! I would thoroughly recommend this hotel and would definately go back there again.
reviews.title: Fab Hotel

reviews.text: Upon our arrival at the hotel, it looked really nice and well designed but the pleasure soon ended when we were greeted by Majorca's most joyless receptionist: Joan. It would have been lovely if he managed to crack a smile every so often.
reviews.title: Too good to be true? Yes?

reviews.text: We spent 5 nights at this hotel and really enjoyed our stay. We couldn't fault the food for the price we paid ( £250 each for flights, transfers and A1) Upon arrival after midnight we were shown into the dining area where a small buffet had been laid out , we were also given a drinks voucher to get 2 free drinks at the cocktail bar as A1 had ended. You could help yourself to beer, coffee, tea, soft drinks, water, wine and sangria at the Hotel and Beach Bar. The beach bar was a godsend on the beach, lots of tables and chairs but not many sunbeds, some people just used bLow up beds which could be bought locally instead Do not forget to bring beach towels as they are not provided at the hotel. Part of the dining area overlooked the lake and was a quiet pleasant area to eat your evening meal, it is through the patio doors at the back of the dining room. To the front of the hotel was the Hotel cocktail bar which was quite pleasant but not part of A1, we just took our a1 drinks out there. We were quite satisfied with the food, one night there was ribs, another mussels and duck al'orange etc, we still took the opportunity to eat out on two occasions, once at the Tapas Restaurant 'S'amfora' Which was excellent, but the portions are big so be warned, we also dined at 'Roma' opposite the hotel, which was served pizza, grilled food etc. My chicken kebab on a scewer was very dry and a disappointment and my partners seafood pizza was bland, it may have just been an off day as the restaurant always seemed to be busy and it is not the cheapest place to eat.
reviews.title: Fantastic short break!

reviews.text: The clientele is predominantly German, Dutch, and Scandinavian, but this didn't bother us and we did meet a few other British couples with whom we had a drink and a laugh with. The entertainment guy, the young guy at the cocktail bar, if fact most of the staff - were friendly enough and spoke good English.
reviews.title: hotel boccaccio

reviews.text: The pool is quite small but adequate for children to splash about in. There are stairs by the pool leading up to a nice terrace area, but there is no shade and you will have to come downstairs for your drinks (only a short trip though)
reviews.title: great hotel
Sad to leave
reviews.text: We had a basic room overlooking the entertainment area which was basic, clean, and met our needs for the short time we were in it. The rooms, like the hotel and indeed the area itself were rather tired, but this did not impair our experience. We did not pay a great deal of money to come here, so the holiday represented great value for money and met our expectations within this price range.

Couple of further points, there is liquid soap available for shampooing and showering in the bathrooms so you don't need to bring this . Our room did not have a hair dryer. (Luckily I had brought mine) There is a fridge which was off but we didn't use anyway, there is a safe deposit box for hire at €2 per day. You will need to bring your own beach towels but they are available to purchase in the resort if you are travelling light. Cava is part of A1 and was lovely so don't be afraid to ask them to pop open a bottle for you!
reviews.title: Lovely hotel.

reviews.text: I write this review as I am still staying at this Hotel, staying all inclusive.
reviews.title: Not for the English..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Most guests are Spanish and German and are very well catered for, but little effort has been made to make guests from the u.k welcome.
reviews.title: great stay in Alcudia

reviews.text: The music, entertainment and members of staff are all geared up to cope well with usual visitors.
reviews.title: 2nd visit - less happy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The usual all inclusive gripes apply, tiny thimbles to serve beer in, tiny bar and language barrier that can be frustrating.
reviews.title: Average hotel for older people

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The loungers beside the pool are unbelievably uncomfortable hence why not many people bother, and 20€ PER PHONE to use WiFi seems a bit steep.
reviews.title: Never ever again..
